body_content.explanation: a piece of planned work or an activity that is finished over a period of time and intended to achieve a particular purpose:
examples: Her latest project is a film based on the life of a 19th-century music hall star.
My next project is decorating the kitchen.

body_content.explanation: a study of a particular subject done over a period of time, especially by students:
examples: He's doing a class project on pollution.
In our third year at college everyone had to do a special project.

body_content.explanation: to calculate an amount or number expected in the future from information already known:
examples: Government spending is projected to rise by three percent next year.

body_content.explanation: to throw or direct something forwards, with force:
examples: 90 percent of the projected missiles will hit their target.

body_content.explanation: to sing or speak loudly and clearly:
examples: It's a big theatre so you really have to project your voice if you're going to be heard at the back.

body_content.explanation: to cause a film, image, or light to appear on a screen or other surface:
examples: Laser images were projected onto a screen.

body_content.explanation: to wrongly imagine that someone else is feeling a particular emotion or desire when in fact it is you who feels this way:
examples: I suspect he's projecting his fears onto you.

body_content.explanation: If you project a particular quality, that quality is what most people notice about you:
examples: Recently the president has sought to project a much tougher image.

body_content.explanation: to stick out over an edge or from a surface:
examples: The hotel dining room projects out over the water.
